sec.title: Overview of 12th ICNE Conference: 7–8 September 2011
sec.p: As an independent lay member of the University of Surrey Ethics Committee I had the opportunity to attend this year’s ICNE Conference at the University of Surrey campus in Guildford, UK. The following represents my layperson’s overview of proceedings.
All of these aspects emerged over the two days from the presentations and the subsequent discussions that ensued – both formally and informally.

Towards the end of the Conference it was fitting that many of the values that had been discussed and highlighted over the two days were illustrated in the activities and achievements of the respective recipients of the Human Rights and Nursing Awards. These are presented annually in recognition of outstanding commitment to human rights and exemplifying the essence of nursing’s humanistic philosophy. On this occasion the presentations were made by the Vice-Chancellor of the University of Surrey, Professor Christopher Snowden. One award went jointly to Masitsela Mhlanga and Thabsile Dlamini from the Swaziland Nursing Association for their respective contributions over many years. The other went to Ana Luisa Aranha e Silva from the School of Nursing at the University of Sao Paulo, Brazil for her work in the field of mental health.
At the conclusion of the Conference it was announced that the 2012 ICNE Conference will be in Turkey, organized by Leyla Dinc and colleagues – details will be available soon.
